00052 // This is an ONE-TIME parser used by KviKvsScript
00053 
00054 class KVIRC_API KviKvsParser
00055 {
00056         friend class KviKvsKernel;
00057 public:
00058         KviKvsParser(KviKvsScript * pScript,KviWindow * pOutputWindow);
00059         ~KviKvsParser();
00060 private:
00061         const QChar              * m_pBuffer;        // the local pointer to the beginning of the buffer
00062         const QChar              * m_ptr;            // the parsing pointer
00063         // parsing state
00064         KviPointerHashTable<QString,QString>           * m_pGlobals;       // the dict of the vars declared with global in this script
00065         int                        m_iFlags;         // the current parsing flags
00066         bool                       m_bError;         // error(..) was called ?
00067         // this stuff is used only for reporting errors and warnings
00068         KviKvsScript             * m_pScript;        // parent script
00069         KviWindow                * m_pWindow;        // output window
00070 public: // public interface
00071         enum Flags { AssumeLocals = 1, Pedantic = 2 };
00072         // was there an error ?
00073         bool error() const { return m_bError; };
00074         // parses the buffer pointed by pBuffer and returns
00075         // a syntax tree or 0 in case of failure
00076         // if the parsing fails, the error code can be retrieved by calling error()
00077         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction * parse(const QChar * pBuffer,int iFlags = 0);
00078         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction * parseAsExpression(const QChar * pBuffer,int iFlags = 0);
00079         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction * parseAsParameter(const QChar * pBuffer,int iFlags = 0);
00080 private: // parsing helpers
00081         // generic
00082         void skipSpaces(); // skips only spaces and tabs (eventually with \)
00083         bool skipSpacesAndNewlines(); // skips space and newlines
00084         void skipToNextLine(); // skips up to a new line
00085         // dedicated
00086         void skipToEndOfCStyleComment();
00087         // dedicated to parseSpecialCommandFor() : in KviKvsParser_specialCommands.cpp
00088         bool skipToEndOfForControlBlock();
00089         // error handlers
00090         void error(const QChar * pLocation,const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00091         void warning(const QChar * pLocation,const QString &szMsgFmt,...);
00092         void errorBadChar(const QChar * pLocation,char cExpected,const char * szCommandName);
00093 
00094 protected:
00095         // this is called by KviKvsKernel to register the parsing routines
00096         static void init();
00097 private:
00098         // returns 0 only in case of error
00099         // starts on the first char of a buffer
00100         // stops at the first null char encountered
00101         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction                * parseInstructionList();
00102         // may return 0 (empty instruction), check error() for error conditions
00103         // starts on the first character of an instruction
00104         // if the first char is ';' '\n' or null it just returns 0 without error
00105         // stops after the ending char of the instruction
00106         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction                * parseInstruction();
00107         // may return 0 (empty block), check error() for error conditions
00108         // starts at the leading '{' of the block
00109         // stops after the trailing '}' of the block
00110         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction                * parseInstructionBlock();
00111         // returns 0 only in case of error
00112         // starts on the first character of the parameters
00113         // ends after the end of the command
00114         KviKvsTreeNodeDataList                   * parseCommandParameterList();
00115         // returns 0 only in case of error
00116         // starts on the leading '(' or a ',' in the middle of the list
00117         // ends after the trailing ')'
00118         // if started in the middle of the list returns only the remaining
00119         // parameters.
00120         KviKvsTreeNodeDataList                   * parseCommaSeparatedParameterList();
00121         KviPointerList<QString>                      * parseCommaSeparatedParameterListNoTree();
00122         // returns 0 in case of error or if it starts on a terminating character (null parameter)
00123         // check error() to see if there was an error condition (unless you already know that
00124         // there was a valid first character)
00125         // start on the first character of the parameter
00126         // ends after the first character not included in the param (';','\n','\0',' ')
00127         // If bPreferNumeric is true then when a single literal parameter
00128         // is extracted an attempt to convert it to a numeric format is made.
00129         // This optimizes assignments, self-sums etc...
00130         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseCommandParameter(bool bPreferNumeric = false);
00131         // returns 0 only in case of error
00132         // start on the first character of the parameter
00133         // ends after the first character not included in the param (')','\n','\0',',')
00134         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseCommaSeparatedParameter();
00135         // returns 0 only in case of error
00136         // start on the first character of the parameter
00137         // ends after the first character not included in the param (')','\n','\0')
00138         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseSingleParameterInParenthesis();
00139         // never returns 0
00140         KviKvsTreeNodeConstantData               * parseCommandLiteralParameter();
00141         // never returns 0
00142         KviKvsTreeNodeConstantData               * parseCommaSeparatedLiteralParameter();
00143         // never returns 0
00144         KviKvsTreeNodeConstantData               * parseSingleLiteralParameterInParenthesis();
00145         // returns 0 only in case of error
00146         // starts at the leading '"'
00147         // ends after the trailing '"'
00148         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseStringParameter();
00149         // never returns 0
00150         KviKvsTreeNodeConstantData               * parseStringLiteralParameter();
00151         // returns 0 in case of error or of an empty switch list (check the error code!)
00152         // starts at the leading '-' of the first switch
00153         // ends after the last switch
00154         KviKvsTreeNodeSwitchList                 * parseCommandSwitchList();
00155         // returns 0 only in case of error
00156         // starts at '%' or '$'
00157         // and ends after the end of the data reference
00158         // or just after the '%' or '$' if this was only a ConstandData (not a var or func)
00159         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseParameterPercentOrDollar();
00160         // returns 0 only in case of error
00161         // starts at '%' or '$'
00162         // ends after the end of the complete data reference (including scope operators!)
00163         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parsePercentOrDollar(bool bInObjScope = false);
00164         // returns 0 only in case of error
00165         // starts at '%'
00166         // ends after the end of the structured data
00167         KviKvsTreeNodeVariable                   * parsePercent(bool bInObjectScope = false);
00168         // returns 0 only in case of error
00169         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseHashKey();
00170         // never returns 0
00171         KviKvsTreeNodeConstantData               * parseHashKeyLiteralParameter();
00172 
00173         //
00174         // KviKvsParser_specialCommands.cpp
00175         //
00176 
00177         // return 0 only in case of error
00178         // starts at the leading '(' of the if command (after the switches)
00179         // and stops after the end of the else block
00180         // if the first character is not '(' then this function fails with an error
00181         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandIf();
00182         // always returns 0
00183         // check error() for error conditions
00184         // starts after the switches of the "global" keyword
00185         // and stops at the end of the command
00186         // if the first character is not '%' of a variable then this function fails with an error
00187         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandGlobal();
00188         // returns 0 only in case of error
00189         // starts at the leading '(' of the while command (after the switches)
00190         // and stops after the end of the command block
00191         // if the first character is not '(' then this function fails with an error
00192         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandWhile();
00193         // returns 0 only in case of error
00194         // starts at the leading '(' of the while command (after the switches)
00195         // and stops after the end of the command block
00196         // if the first character is not '(' then this function fails with an error
00197         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandDo();
00198         // returns 0 only in case of error
00199         // and stops after the end of the break command
00200         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandBreak();
00201         // returns 0 only in case of error
00202         // and jumps to the next iteration after the end of the continue command
00203         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandContinue();
00204         // returns 0 only in case of error
00205         // and stops after the end of the for command block
00206         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandFor();
00207         // returns 0 only in case of error
00208         // and stops after the end of the foreach command block
00209         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandForeach();
00210         // returns 0 only in case of error
00211         // and stops after the end of the switch command block
00212         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandSwitch();
00213         // returns 0 only in case of error
00214         // and stops after the end of the defpopup command block
00215         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandUnset();
00216         // returns 0 only in case of error
00217         // and stops after the end of the defpopup command block
00218         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandDefpopup();
00219         KviKvsTreeNodeSpecialCommandDefpopupLabelPopup * parseSpecialCommandDefpopupLabelPopup();
00220         // returns 0 only in case of error
00221         // stops after the class command block
00222         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandClass();
00223         // returns 0 only in case of error
00224         // stops after the perl.end statement
00225         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandPerlBegin();
00226         // returns 0 only in case of error
00227         // stops after the perl.end statement
00228         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandPythonBegin();
00229         // returns 0 only in case of error
00230         // and stops after the end of the help command
00231         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseSpecialCommandHelp();
00232 
00233         //
00234         // KviKvsParser_command.cpp
00235         //
00236 
00237         // may return 0 (empty command), check error() for error conditions
00238         // starts at the beginning of a command (can be non valid)
00239         // ends after the ending char of the command
00240         KviKvsTreeNodeCommand                    * parseCommand();
00241 
00242 
00243         //
00244         // KviKvsParser_comment.cpp
00245         //
00246 
00247         // always returns 0, and it CAN be an error!
00248         // starts at the beginning of a comment (must be '#' or '/')
00249         // ends after the ending char of the comment
00250         KviKvsTreeNode                           * parseComment();
00251 
00252 
00253         //
00254         // KviKvsParser_dollar.cpp
00255         //
00256 
00257         // returns 0 only in case of error
00258         // starts at '$'
00259         // ends after the end of the function call
00260         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseDollar(bool bInObjScope = false);
00261 
00262         // returns 0 only in case of error
00263         // starts at '@'
00264         // ends after the end of the function call
00265         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseAt(bool bInObjScope = false);
00266 
00267         //
00268         // KviKvsParser_lside.cpp
00269         //
00270 
00271         // returns 0 only in case of error
00272         // returns after the command terminator
00273         KviKvsTreeNodeInstruction                * parseVoidFunctionCallOrOperation();
00274         // returns 0 only in case of error
00275         // returns after the command terminator
00276         KviKvsTreeNodeOperation                  * parseOperation();
00277         // returns 0 only in case of error
00278         // returns after the command terminator
00279         // If bPreferNumeric is propagated to parseCommandParameter() function
00280         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseOperationRightSide(bool bPreferNumeric = false);
00281         // return 0 only in case of error
00282         // returns after the command terminator
00283         KviKvsTreeNodeOperation                  * parseBindingOperation();
00284         KviKvsTreeNodeConstantData               * parseBindingOperationLiteralParameter();
00285         KviKvsTreeNodeData                       * parseBindingOperationParameter();
00286 
00287         //
00288         // KviKvsParser_expression.cpp
00289         //
00290 
00291         // returns 0 only in case of error
00292         // starts AFTER the leading char of the expression
00293         // ends afer the first terminator found
00294         KviKvsTreeNodeExpression                * parseExpression(char terminator);
00295         KviKvsTreeNodeExpressionBinaryOperator  * parseExpressionBinaryOperator();
00296         KviKvsTreeNodeExpression                * parseExpressionOperand(char terminator);
00297         KviKvsTreeNodeExpression                * parseExpressionOperandCore(char terminator);
00298         bool                                      parseExpressionMightPointToOperator();
00299 
00300         void report(bool bError,const QChar * pLocation,const QString &szMsgFmt,kvi_va_list va);
